author: Luis Cruz
subject: Re: "Lupin in English FAQ" commentary.
body:
> :-)  The  'Mamo' name was coined by a Streamline employee, if I remember
the
> interviews I have read.  I haven't seen a raw Japanese version of the film
> (yet) so I'm not sure if the name 'Mamoo' is actually used.

I have a feeling that is partially true; in the program that was released
for
the film, there is a voice credit for a character called "Mamou".  Whether
or
not this name is actually used in the movie dialogue remains to be heard.
The Streamline employee probably decided "Mystery of Mamo" sounded better
than
"Lupin vs. the Clones".

> of Mamo' in english on the LD cover. The second explanation is that the
name
> 'Mamoo' crops up as a villian name in either the First or Second TV series
> (ill have to check my synposes)

I thought it was from the 2nd series; did a quick scan of the Toon Magazine
synopses, but couldn't find the reference.  Will read more thoroughly and
have an answer tomorrow.

> If these S. Baldric subs are bootlegs, who are they stolen from?  I know

Think bootlegger in the sense that he was selling fansubs for a profit.

---
"I have a To Do pile?!" - Homer Simpson

Luis A. Cruz
cruzl@ccs.neu.edu
